intro: Symplococarpon airy-shawianum, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a rare and striking member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in clusters, giving it a celestial appearance. The plant has a compact, herbaceous growth habit with finely divided, fern-like leaves. Native to southern Africa, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. Due to its rarity and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts.
